skill.name: decisions
skill.description: Load past architectural decisions. Use when making new decisions to ensure consistency.
skill.summary: Load past architectural decisions. Use when making new decisions to ensure consistency.
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill that retrieves historical architectural decisions using read-only file operations. The static analysis flagged JSON structure and tool function names as suspicious patterns, but these are false positives. The skill only uses Glob and Read tools to access local decision files in memory/knowledge/decisions/. No network access, code execution, or external command capabilities exist.

content.value_statement: Teams often repeat past mistakes or forget why certain choices were made. This skill provides access to historical decision records so new decisions align with established patterns and avoid re-litigating settled questions.
actual_capabilities: Load past architectural decisions from memory/knowledge/decisions/
Check for existing decisions before making new ones using Glob patterns
Read decision context, options considered, and rationale
Format new decisions with standard JSON structure
limitations: Only accesses local decision files, does not create or modify them
Does not enforce decisions, only provides information
Relies on existing decision records in memory/knowledge/decisions/
No network connectivity or external integrations

use_cases.title: Maintain design consistency
use_cases.description: Reference past decisions to ensure new features align with established patterns and technical direction

use_cases.title: Avoid re-litigating choices
use_cases.description: Quickly find why previous decisions were made to prevent repeating debates on settled questions

use_cases.title: Learn project context
use_cases.description: Understand the reasoning behind architectural choices without asking team members for explanations

prompt_templates.title: Check existing decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if a decision exists for [topic] in memory/knowledge/decisions/ and summarize the existing rationale

prompt_templates.title: Review related decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all decisions related to [component/pattern] and explain the chosen approaches

prompt_templates.title: Document new decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me format this decision using the standard format: Context: [why], Options: [A, B], Decision: [chosen], Rationale: [why]

prompt_templates.title: Audit decision history
prompt_templates.prompt: List all accepted decisions in memory/knowledge/decisions/ and identify any that may need revision

output_examples.input: Check if a decision exists for authentication approach in memory/knowledge/decisions/
output: Decision: Use OAuth 2.0 with PKCE for user authentication
Rationale: Industry standard, good security properties, multiple provider support
Alternatives considered: Session-based auth (complex state management), JWT tokens (storage concerns)

output_examples.input: Find all decisions related to database patterns
output: DEC-005: Read replicas for query scaling (2024-02-10)

best_practices: Always check for existing decisions before proposing new architectural changes
When diverging from past decisions, document the reasoning explicitly
Keep decision records concise but include enough context for future maintainers
anti_patterns: Ignoring existing decisions and re-litigating settled questions
Creating new decisions without reviewing relevant past ones
Recording decisions without sufficient rationale for future context

faq.question: What tools can use this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It only uses Glob and Read tools which are available on all platforms.

faq.question: Where are decisions stored?
faq.answer: Decision records are stored as JSON files in memory/knowledge/decisions/ within the project structure.

faq.question: Can this skill modify decisions?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only skill. It only loads and displays existing decisions. Use project-specific tools to create or modify records.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads local files and makes no network calls. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are decisions not being found?
faq.answer: Ensure decision files follow the standard JSON format and are located in memory/knowledge/decisions/ with .json extension.

faq.question: How is this different from patterns skill?
faq.answer: Decisions records why specific choices were made. Patterns skill shows reusable code structures. Use decisions to understand context, patterns to implement solutions.
